definition: to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia

sentences.english: It is a simple blackmailing for the companies working in the region.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个简单的敲诈勒索的公司在该地区工作。

sentences.english: He often extorts money from her.
So you get kind of ripped off a little bit, and there's a lot of people who are not too happy about that.
sentences.chinese: 所以，你有点像是被敲诈勒索了，很多人对此很不满。

sentences.english: The blackmailer had to be paid off. He was too dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 只得向那个敲诈勒索者付钱了，他太危险了。

sentences.english: He broke her by the threat of blackmail.
sentences.chinese: 他用敲诈勒索的威胁使她屈服。

sentences.english: He was indicted for racketeering but never convicted.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控犯敲诈勒索，但却一直没被判决有罪。

sentences.english: It looks like the pictures were being used for blackmail.
sentences.chinese: 这些照片好像被用于敲诈勒索。

sentences.english: He's been charged with extorting protection money from the shopkeepers.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控对店主敲诈勒索保护费。

definition: to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
to exact bribes/to solicit bribes/to demand bribes/to extort
